subject: Sound Dampening Foam Degradation - BLD-Quiet Care
body:
Hi,

I purchased the BreezeLite BLD-Quiet Care dryer on May 2, 2026, specifically for its noise-reduction features.

After about a month of use, I noticed that the dryer has become noticeably louder. When I opened it for inspection, I could see that the sound-dampening foam inside the chamber has started to degrade and break down.

I have followed the care instructions and have never exposed the dryer to liquid or cleaning agents. I only use regular air drying and normal heat settings.

I believe this is a manufacturing defect in the acoustic chamber materials. The dryer is still within the warranty period.

Please advise if this is covered under warranty.

Thanks,
Nancy Garcia
nancy.garcia@email.com
